titlestmt.subtitle: Dan Moldea investigative journalism C0281
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jordan Patty, Edited by Amanda Brent in 2017

publicationstmt.publisher: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-04-12T14:22-0400

change.item: Converted to schema conforming EAD by dtd2schema.vh.xsl.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Libraries.Special Collections Research Center.

did.abstract: Dan Moldea investigative journalism collection consits of resesarch files for six of Dan Moldea's books. The files include research on "Hoffa Wars," "Dark Victory: Ronald Reagan, MCA, and the Mob," "The Killing of Robert F. Kennedy," "Washington Tragedy: How the Suicide of Vincent Foster Ignited a Political Firestorm," "Confessions of a Guerrilla Writer," and "The Hunting of Cain."

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from Dan Moldea investigative journalism collection must be obtained from Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dan Moldea investigative journalism collection, C0282, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by Dan Moldea in 2015 and 2016.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jessica Lynn and Amanda Brent in 2016-2017. EAD markup completed by Jordan Patty. Edited by Amanda Brent in 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Dan Moldea has been an independent investigative journalist specializing on organized crime and political corruption investigations since 1974, as well as a best-selling author who has published eight nonfiction books: "The Hoffa Wars" ( 1978); "The Hunting of Cain: A True Story of Money, Greed, and Fratricide" (1983); "Dark Victory: Ronald Reagan, MCA, and the Mob" (1986); "Interference: How Organized Crime Influences Professional Football" (1989); "The Killing of Robert F. Kennedy" (1995); "Evidence Dismissed: The Inside Story of the Police Investigation of O.J. Simpson" (with Tom Lange and Philip Vannatter, 1997); and "A Washington Tragedy: How the Suicide of Vincent Foster Ignited a Political Firestorm" (1998). He recently published his memoir "Confessions of a Guerrilla Writer: Adventures in the Jungles of Crime, Politics and Journalism" (2013).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Dan Moldea investigative journalism collection consits of resesarch files for six of Dan Moldea's books. The files include research on "Hoffa Wars," "Dark Victory: Ronald Reagan, MCA, and the Mob," "The Killing of Robert F. Kennedy," "Washington Tragedy: How the Suicide of Vincent Foster Ignited a Political Firestorm,""Confessions of a Guerrilla Writer," and "The Hunting of Cain." The files are largely arranged by book chapter and by subject.

list.item: Series 2: "Dark Victory: Ronald Reagan, MCA, and the Mob" research, 1937-1997 (Boxes 4-5)
Series 3: "The Killing of Robert F. Kennedy" research, 1950s-2008 (Boxes 6-7)
Series 4: "Washington Tragedy: How the Suicide of Vincent Foster Ignited a Political Firestorm" research, 1992-2007 (Boxes 8-9)
Series 5: "Confessions of a Guerrilla Writer" research, 1962-2013 (Boxes 10-14)

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections Research Center holds the that includes photographs of Robert F. Kennedy and Jimmy Hoffa.
